body.p: When Indians come through Wisconsin Dells always stop at Stand Rock and talk with friends and people stop this week and tell about pick blueberries up by Fairchild, Washburn, Iron River and tell Indian reporter season all over and pretty good berries there. I want to tell you one thing sure blueberries pretty good to have in winter time and another thing want to say when eat blueberries help rheumatism like people have and when Indian reporter eat them he dance just as good Indian dance as young buck and make him want to do things just like young fellow. Game warden around here don’t bother Indian when he fish and just catch fish to eat and up by Tomah every time Indian go near where people fish game warden jump out of brush and say “where your license” and then have to go to Sparta and judge tell you go to jail for 90 days. Yesterday Indian reporter get three big fish and that night we have big fish feed. Tomah people come up to Indian reporter Sunday night at Indian ceremonial where I hand out cards and tell about have no rain since I come down here and want me to come back Tomah and make big rain like I do 25th May. I tell folks about how I sell Tom-tom to Soderstrom at Power Co. place and tell them I put it in paper this week about have Soderstrom beat tom-tom and sing song on high hill and make rain. In camp woman name Good Star Woman and been pretty sick. Yesterday she go out in woods to get some tobacco and over 80 years old and blind. She go out in woods with daughter and tells them what kind of trees when touch with hands and get one she wants for her tobacco. White man call tree willow and Indian call same thing Kinnikinnie. She take rough bark off tree and scrape stick and make pile of shavings and dry them and mix with tobacco for pipe. Good Star Woman come from Winnebago, Nebraska but she is Sioux Indian. Indian reporter glad to come back to Wisconsin Dells every year and see country that was Indian country long time back. Long time back my people make mounds all around Dells and Portage and Devil’s Lake. Indian reporter camp with father when young boy and one time father catch big muskeilunge just below dam here. It free country then and Indians could take game they want to eat and now when Indian do same thing get 90 days in jail and too many white men game wardens. People tell Indian reporter Myron Lowe who is Indian from Black River Falls going to box at big fight show at Tomah Fair 4th August and too bad Indians at Stand Rock can’t come to fair and see Myron Lowe box. Next night Indian reporter maybe go to fair at Tomah and talk to people and be part of program and see boss at Stand Rock and see if I can go. That’s enough. Too hot day to write Indian News. .
